title: ‘The sun is up and we’re fighting’: Bill O’Brien’s fiery response to question about Boston College football
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Boston College football coach Bill O'Brien responded defiantly to questions about the team's 1-8 season record.
O'Brien emphasized the team's determination and positive mindset, despite underperforming in the 2025 season.
Boston College has three games remaining, with uncertainty about O'Brien's future as head coach.

title: Apparently, Mass. had a ‘gustnado’ touch down Monday night — and more wind is coming
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: A 'gustnado' with wind gusts up to 40 mph hit Massachusetts on Monday, says the National Weather Service.
Southern New England is under a high wind watch with gusts up to 65 mph possible Wednesday night.
Winds could reach 70-75 mph on Cape Cod, causing potential tree damage and power outages in Massachusetts.

title: Trio sought in alleged unprovoked Halloween attack at downtown T station
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: MBTA police are seeking help identifying three suspects in an unprovoked Halloween attack at State Street station.
The incident occurred around 11 p.m. on October 31, involving multiple suspects assaulting a victim without provocation.
Police released surveillance photos and ask anyone with information to contact MBTA police anonymously at 617-222-1050.

title: Bob Dylan accepts honorary doctorate from Berklee – just in time for tribute show
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Bob Dylan received an honorary doctorate from Boston's Berklee College of Music, his first from an American university since 1970.
Berklee hosted a tribute concert titled 'Watching the River Flow: A Roots Salute to Bob Dylan' on November 5, 2025.
Dylan's honorary degree adds him to Berklee's list of honorees, including Duke Ellington, Aretha Franklin, and Quincy Jones.

title: Revolution reportedly set to hire Marko Mitrovic as head coach
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Marko Mitrovic set to become the New England Revolution head coach, previously led the U.S. U-20 national team.
Mitrovic, a naturalized U.S. citizen, guided the U.S. youth team to the quarterfinals at the 2025 U-20 World Cup.
Revolution seek a new direction, departing from previous hires, Bruce Arena and Caleb Porter, amid recent challenges.

title: Trevor Story decides to stay with Red Sox, won’t opt out of contract
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Trevor Story will not opt out of his contract with the Red Sox, remaining with the team for two more years.
Story, who signed a six-year, $140 million deal in 2022, chose to stay due to his appreciation for the organization.
This decision impacts Boston's infield strategy as they focus on signing Alex Bregman and integrating Marcelo Mayer.

title: Marat Khusnutdinov keeps cashing in on his opportunities with Bruins
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Marat Khusnutdinov scored a shootout winner for the Boston Bruins against the Islanders, helping secure a 4-3 victory.
Khusnutdinov, replacing injured Elias Lindholm, has scored two goals in the Bruins' last three games.
Coach Marco Sturm has increasingly trusted Khusnutdinov, using him over top scorers like David Pastrnak during crucial moments.

title: Recent homes sales in Greater Boston (Nov. 5)
author: The Boston Globe
bullets: A Colonial home at 16 Silver Hill Road, Acton, sold for $1,160,000 with 4 bedrooms and 4 baths.
A Boston condo at 776 Boylston St. #W9B sold for $8,000,000, featuring 2 bedrooms and 3 baths.
In Allston, a two-family duplex at 42-44 Aldie St. was sold for $1,600,000 with 16 rooms and 6 bedrooms.

title: ‘Landslide’: Santana beats out Baker, Wu says, while Culpepper wins D7
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Rev. Miniard Culpepper wins Boston's District 7 council seat after Tania Fernandes Anderson stepped down.
At-Large City Councilor Henry Santana secures reelection, beating out former Councilor Frank Baker.
All incumbent district councilors win reelection, while Mayor Wu's coalition maintains council composition.

title: Jake Wilson to be Somerville’s next mayor, unofficial results show
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Jake Wilson received 11,185 votes in Somerville's mayoral election, leading opponent Willie Burnley Jr. by 2,131 votes.
Wilson's campaign focused on enhancing city services and tackling crises in housing, street safety, and rodent issues.
Outgoing Mayor Katjana Ballantyne was eliminated in September; Wilson announced candidacy in December 2024.
